medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever, chills, arthralgias, abdominal and testicular pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had a 2-week history of symptoms starting with fever, chills, arthralgias, and abdominal and testicular pain. Anorexia and fatigue developed 14 days before admission, alongside pain and tightness in the back and calves. Symptoms became severe enough to impair walking, with fever reaching 38.9Â°C and persisting chills, sweats, and myalgias which worsened with temperature spikes.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of pulmonary tuberculosis diagnosed 25 years prior, completed treatment, with a chronic cough persisting. History of hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection with a positive test for HBV surface antigen 12 years prior, but no elevated alpha-fetoprotein levels or malignancy detected in annual surveillance.
medical_history.family_history: Father died from lung cancer at 71 years old; mother died at 39 years old from an unknown cause; no other relevant family medical history reported.
medical_history.social_history: Smoked a half pack of cigarettes daily for more than 40 years, consumed one glass of wine nightly. Retired from restaurant work two years prior and traveled to China three years ago. No illicit drug use reported.
